title: Normal Draft Pick Matchmaking

embed.description: Super simple and lightning fast image sharing. Upload clipboard images with Copy & Paste and image files with Drag & Drop

body:
How on earth do you people sort out matchmaking? I'm currently bronze 2 and most of the people I play with aren't higher than Silver 1, yet every game we're getting matched against people who are vastly out of our league. 

How are we supposed to have fun when queues are so mismatched skill wise?

replies.body:
Normals mmr and ranked mmr are not the same.
In normals you will be matched with anyone and everyone (even in draft pick for NA).

A lot of higher ranked players (in ranked), have low normal mmr as they don't play that queue that often. This can sometimes lead to them getting matched with lower level players.

You also have to take into consideration that these players might be duo with a friend that is lower level, or rank, and that could result in the match.

Now if oce actually had normals draft we could relate..xD

As unfair as it may feel, normals mmr and ranked mmr are completely separate, so diamonds who have barely played any norms can easily get matched with bronze/silver who have played a lot of norms. If you really want to have an evenly matched game i'd suggest Ranked Solo/Duo, apart from that not much you can do about matchmaking :/

The problem is not that higher elo players get matched with lower elo players, the real problem is when all the high elo players are in the same team vs a lower elo team, as is op's case(and mine for the most part).

I think I meant to post this on NA boards, lol. 

And yeah, it's not always bad going against them as it is does help learn, but it's still not fun when majority of the games played end up being losses because of it. 

OCE not having normal draft is a big part of the reason why I moved to NA. Ranked is stressful and blind pick is just a mess to me.

I actually like this. Any time I get to play with or against a higher ranked player I learn something. In normal games that is what it is all about (for me at least).

If I can outsmart a Diamond or Platinum player for even one instance of a whole game I feel like I have achieved something.
I watch what they do and how they play which gives me knowledge on how to become a better player myself, so I welcome the challenge.

I guess everybody sees things differently.
